<I can change that.> Empath points out.  Aloud, she says, "Right 
here."  She halts in front of a few empty rooms.  "Take your pick, 
kids.  I'm going to get myself some refreshment."

She walks off toward the lounge.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Lizzie: Where are we going?
> 
> In the same time, Sanguine controlled the fury burning inside her. 
She 
> wasn't notorious. There were a lot of forms that she had used which 
> were notorious, but never had the name Sanguine been wanted.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > <Perhaps you can,> Empath tells her, <but remember that a 
criminal 
> as 
> > notorious as yourself is not as likely to gain amnesty as I am.  
YOU 
> > may the one who gets slagged if some of the less tolerant 
Maximals 
> > find you out.  And the Vok are not such an easy target that you 
can 
> > hunt them out single-handedly.>
> > 
> > "This way please," she says aloud, leading the pair down the 
> corridor.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Lizzie yawns and seems disinterested.
> > > 
> > > Lizzie: Yes, some quarters could be good.
> > > 
> > > Her greater Sanguine part then realized that Empath was a 
> telepath.
> > > {Telepath, eh? Well read my mind. I don't give a slag of the 
> maxies 
> > or 
> > > the preds. I'm here for the Vok and I'm going to slag them. 
Either 
> > > you're good to yourself and you stay out of my way, or you're 
not 
> > and 
> > > I get forced to slag you. In the meantime, I can help you.}
